alert.note: Alert for Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 8:36PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Cherry, northwestern Grant and southeastern Sheridan Counties through 815 PM MDT... At 736 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ashby to near Ellsworth. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ashby, Watson Lake, Dipping Vat Meadow, Hire, Wolf Hill, Finnegan Lake, Whitman Road crossing the North Branch of the Middle Loup River, Mother Lake, Argo Hill and Kennedy Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 133 and 144. Highway 61 between mile markers 160 and 181. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
